bestBHT.bht: As the Lord is the only competent examiner, we should not judge or criticize prematurely. Rather, we should wait for the day when God will reveal the hidden things of darkness and manifest the counsels of our hearts. In our quest for praise, let us remember that it is the Lord who will adjudicate and give each person their due, according to their faithfulness. By refraining from passing judgment and allowing God to bring the hidden to light, we demonstrate trust in His ultimate judgment.

Henry Alford: So then (because the Lord is the sole infallible dijudicator) judge nothing (concerning us, of merit or demerit) before the time."
And make manifest the counsels of the hearts (then first showing, what your teachers really are, in heart).
Let them wait till the day when the fitting praise (be it what it may) will be adjudged to each from God.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Therefore—as the Lord is the sole Decider or Dijudicator.
Lord—Jesus Christ, whose 'ministers' we are, and who is to be the judge.
then shall every man have praise—his due praise, not exaggerated praise.
Albert Barnes: Judge nothing - Pass no decided opinion... not to pass a harsh opinion on the conduct of any man, since there are so many things that go to make up his character which we cannot know."
The hidden things of darkness - The secret things of the heart which have been hidden as it were in darkness."
And then shall every man have praise of God - ...every man shall receive what is due to his character, whether good or evil.
Marvin Vincent: The Lord is the only competent examiner therefore do not judge until He comes to judgment.
Even I myself am not competent to institute a conclusive examination, for the absence of condemnation from my conscience does not absolutely acquit me.
See the critical note on 1 John 3:19-22.
John Calvin: For there are some things that are now seen openly, while there are others that lie buried in obscurity until the day of Christ."
It is because there are wonderful recesses and deepest lurking-places in the hearts of men. Hence, until the thoughts of the hearts are brought to light, there will always be darkness."
You do that before the time — before it has become manifest who is worthy to be crowned, but the Lord has appointed a day on which he will make it manifest.
Philip Schaff: Wherefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes."
Make manifest the counsels of the hearts.
Each man shall have his praise from God according to his fidelity.
Archibald T. Robertson: Stop passing judgment, stop criticizing as they were doing. See the words of Jesus in Matthew 7:1. The censorious habit was ruining the Corinthian Church.
Do not therefore anticipate the great judgment (κρισις) by any preliminary investigation (ανακρισις) which must be futile and incomplete.
By turning on the light the counsels of all hearts stand revealed.
John Gill: Be slow in judgment... it is best to leave things to the great day of account, than to be free in censuring one another."
The Lord... will bring to light the hidden things of darkness... and will make manifest the counsels of the heart.
And then shall every man have praise of God... the true ministers of the word will have another day, however despised and criticised by men now.
John Wesley: Therefore judge nothing before the time — Appointed for judging all men.
[The Lord] will both bring to light the things which are now covered with impenetrable darkness, and manifest the most secret springs of action, the principles and intentions of every heart.
And then shall every one — Every faithful steward, have praise of God.

bhtAttempts.bht: Because the Lord is the sole infallible judge, we should not rush to judge others before the appointed time. Instead, we should focus on revealing the true intentions and motives of our hearts, for only then will the praise we receive from God be just and true. By refraining from hasty judgments, we emulate Jesus Christ, who is the ultimate judge and to whom all praise and judgment belong. We must remember that only the Lord can fully examine and uncover the hidden depths of the human heart. So let us refrain from passing judgment prematurely, allowing God to bring to light the things that are currently concealed in darkness.

Because the Lord is the sole infallible judge, we should refrain from passing judgment before the appointed time. Instead, we should focus on manifesting the true intentions of our hearts, waiting for the day when God will offer deserving praise to each individual. As human beings, we lack the ability to conduct a definitive examination, as our consciences are not absolute in their acquittal. Thus, we should avoid premature judgments and allow God to bring hidden truths to light.

Therefore, as the Lord is the sole Decider, we should not judge or criticize others until He comes to pass judgment. Let us wait for the day when each person will receive their due praise from God based on their faithfulness. By refraining from harsh judgments and instead focusing on revealing the true intentions of our hearts, we emulate Jesus Christ, our ultimate judge, and minister. Remember, only God can fully examine and bring to light the hidden thoughts and motives within us. So let us not anticipate the final judgment but trust in God's timing.

As the Lord is the only competent examiner, we should not judge or criticize prematurely. Rather, we should wait for the day when God will reveal the hidden things of darkness and manifest the counsels of our hearts. In our quest for praise, let us remember that it is the Lord who will adjudicate and give each person their due, according to their faithfulness. By refraining from passing judgment and allowing God to bring the hidden to light, we demonstrate trust in His ultimate judgment.

As the Lord is the sole infallible dijudicator, we should judge nothing before the time. Instead, we should make manifest the counsels of the hearts, waiting for the day when God will adjudicate and give each person their due praise. Let us refrain from premature examinations and unjust criticisms, leaving things to the great day of account when the hidden things of darkness will be brought to light. In doing so, we trust in God's ability to reveal the true intentions and motives of every heart.
